intro: Linanthus nuttallii subsp. tenuilobus, commonly known as the slenderleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments, with efficient water conservation mechanisms.
